Q32: I would participate in athletic programs exponentially more if it weren't for the inherent nature of segregation in physical activity. For example, I participated once in a SERVE volleyball club tournament. Each team of 3 had to include "at least one male and one female" to encourage women's participation in a highly male-skewed club population. So there were lots of teams seeking out women to participate and I felt like everyone not just percieved me as a woman, but really WANTED me to be a woman - like it was largest part of my identity to interface with. I stopped signing up for tournaments even though I really do want to play lots of volleyball... I just keep to myself, not making friends because every interaction feels inauthentic to me... Also, I've become incredibly jaded towards whatever actions athletics have done to address transphobia. What the hell are "trans and allies" timeslots? You might as well put up a sign that says "no homophobes please" like it's a warding talisman. Woohoo, you've put up a sign. that doesn't change the fact that the entire building was built without the acknowledgement that trans people exist. Sure you have "accessible washrooms" but where do I put my things? the free day-use lockers are all in the gendered changerooms. only paid ones are outside of them. where the hell do you expect to put my stuff when I'm not supposed to bring my bag into the fitness spaces? It's just a slap in the face, navigating infrastructure with no physical space for you.

I have found my department (pure math) to be thoughtful about the environment. But in teaching and TA roles, I have noticed that the female presenting grad students are treated differently by the students than their male peers. Me and 2 other girls were forced to move out after several instances of someone breaking into our room. 7 other girls were also affected, rooms were broken into while we slept, stuff was stolen and moved around. Beds were made while we were out, doors unlocked after roommate’s had locked them, random items appeared while no one had been in room. They did not care, said it is normal but admitted that a worker was accessing our floor and locks without instruction. The president said he would not do anything about it as it is probably just “boys being boys”. One morning my roommate and I woke up to the maintenance man turning off our lock and opening our door, while I was still in bed. He was also messing with another girls lock. This is when we asked why he was there and they had no explanation. Supposedly he was auditing the locks to see who had been accessing them but later the employees said no, he does not need to access the locks for that, that it is done through a computer upstairs. They even accused one girl of screaming and throwing a tantrum while in a meeting addressing the problem, but she has video proof that that is false. Found tape and hair in our food about 6 times and rarely even ate at Watsons the month we were there because the hours are horrible. Multiple other problems with male residents violating girl’s physical boundaries without real repercussions. They would ignore our complaints for weeks (which were on file and had been addressed in person with dons and other faculty) then claim to never have heard of the issue. During the rooms being broken into we had to BEG for something to be done and for them to notify all the students of the rez, as they seemed to care more about their image than the actual students. Yes we got a full refund for the month stayed, but it seemed as their last attempt to “help” us. Not a great fix. (This occurred September-October 2022). Most of the female employees were helpful but the men were not. Was quite disappointed by this experience as I was excited to live on campus first year and had made friends there. I can say the rooms are very nice as well as the washrooms (which is why I chose to stay here) but the institution needs to work on listening to their students. When paying close to 14k to live somewhere you expect to feel safe, have privacy and have food free of hair. It says in their rez guidelines that no one will enter your room without consent, but they clearly do not listen to their own rules. For instance, after many girls had complained they gave us physical room keys (which were completely useless as the person with a master fob also has access to a master key). The problem was they did not tell us this and WENT INTO OUR ROOMS WITHOUT TELLING US to drop them off. Who in their right mind sees girls terrified that someone is going into their rooms without their knowledge then does exactly that? Luckily, no one was physically harmed but these types of things often escalate into physical attacks and stalking. I do not like to think about what would have happened if my roommate and I had done nothing when they acted like we were crazy for being concerned. Again, they only sat down with us after we told a bunch of people and got parents involved. We understood that yes there wasn’t any physical proof of this so no investigation could be done by campus police but when 10 girls are scared about their safety, you should listen and do more then tell us to lock our doors and put up cameras on ONE of three floors affected. Not to mention how guys who live there overstep many womens boundaries with little to no repercussions. One guy goes into girls beds even if they do not want that. He was not kicked out simply moved to another floor, with other girls he could potentially harass. Theres many more like this but I am not well versed on those instances.

edit: they did audit our door locks (to see if anyone had been opening them other than us) and apparently found nothing. BUT obviously someone had been coming in, they could have turned off the locks entirely to come in, which we know is possible as we caught someone doing this. Also after a meeting with the president (literally 5 minutes after it) another room was broken into while the girls were away and they came back to their door being open. This was after we had made many complaints so they were very careful about locking it, but still someone got around that.
